page.title: 01A DESCRIPTION OF THE D_BLOCK
page.content: In general terms the Block comprises Hale, Hale Barns and Ashley and is divided almost equally between suburban housing in the southern limit of{Trafford Metropolitan District}and the farmland of{Cheshire,}south of the River Bollin. On the whole the houses are either semi_detached or even larger detached properties standing in extensive grounds and any estates are small and privately owned. Some larger houses have been converted into flats or offices as trade benefits from the nearby airport. There are two small shopping areas in Hale and Hale Barns but as bus services are limited residents rely on the railway or public transport. The area's many farms conventrate on cereal crops and the Bollin attracts many hikers. These peaceful suburbs are pleasant, wealthy and unspoilt by industry.
